item.title: [HBASE-12007] StochasticBalancer should avoid putting user regions on master
item.description: We should enhance how StochasticBalancer picks up a random server so that it can avoid putting user regions on master, because regions on master are handled differently in a separate method.
item.summary: StochasticBalancer should avoid putting user regions on master

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

When you say about regions on master server do you mean meta, acl and namespace regions? In branch-1 they are not assigned to master.

I meant any region that is assigned to the master. In branch-1, StochasticBalancer could assign some region to the master since there is no region on it, per the region count skew cost function, then the balancer will move the region away in the another run, which causes the flakiness of TestRegionRebalancing. With this patch, we leave balancing regions on the master server to the base balancer instead of StochasticBalancer.

The regions in the active master are already handled separately.

When you say the above, what does that mean? We have two mechanisms for distributing regions on a cluster?

In branch-1, master can carry regions? DIdn't we disable that for branch-1? Or is it not possible to undo M being a RS?

...&& cluster.isActiveMaster

We could assign to backup master?

Thanks

We have two mechanisms for distributing regions on a cluster?

Regions on master are handled with balanceMasterRegions which is internal to the balancer.

In branch-1, master can carry regions? DIdn't we disable that for branch-1?

Yes, it still can, if configured. It doesn't host any region by default.

Or is it not possible to undo M being a RS?

Very hard, and it is useful for most of use cases.

We could assign to backup master?

Yes, that's right.

We could assign to backup master?

But it is off by default in branch-1?

Very hard, and it is useful for most of use cases.

But it is off in branch-1 (smile). I think it fine that M can be a RS but that it is not on by default.

Regions on master are handled with balanceMasterRegions which is internal to the balancer.

... ok, so only one way of distributing regions... the balancer?

Thanks for bringing me along Jimmy Xiang
Yes, it is off by default in branch-1. Only one way of distributing regions.
+1 on patch then Jimmy Xiang LGTM
+1 It's too bad that there is a split on how we balance masters and normal regionservers. We should think about healing that divide sometime in the future.

Thanks for reviewing it. Integrated into trunk and branch 1.

We should think about healing that divide sometime in the future.

Agreed.
